title: 31.6 Powers of an Element
content:
Section 31.6

Powers of an Element

Summary

Computing aⁿ mod m efficiently using repeated squaring.

Key Points

  • Naive: n-1 multiplications
  • Repeated squaring: O(log n) multiplications
  • a^(2k) = (a^k)², a^(2k+1) = a·(a^k)²
  • Fermat's little theorem: a^(p-1) ≡ 1 (mod p) for prime p
  • Euler's theorem: a^φ(n) ≡ 1 (mod n) if gcd(a,n) = 1

Pseudocode

MODULAR-EXPONENTIATION(a, b, n):
    d = 1
    for i = k downto 0:  # bits of b
        d = (d * d) mod n
        if bit i of b == 1:
            d = (d * a) mod n
    return d

Why It Matters

Core operation for RSA encryption/decryption.
